intro: Microseris castanea, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Microseris castanea is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soils.
